item.title: Another great day for the stock market
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:13, topic:408979”][quote author=Frell link=topic=510262.msg3704024#msg3704024 date=1312925460]

Well the economy is fixing itself

No, its actually going apeshit, DOW is going up and down violently.
[/quote]

Lol today an american woman paid a flight banner to fly a plane over Manhattan (specifically wall street) that said “Thanks for the downgrade, you should all be fired.”
[/quote]rep++

Read full topic

item.title: Another great day for the stock market
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Not true, they’re just stuck in the mindset that giving more money to the companies means theyll run off and hire more people. It makes sense but isn’t human like. And its just as bad as government handouts.

Its basically the same solution approached from different methods. The chances that company will hire more people instead of pocketing the taxes is just as slim as a person fixing their life with a handout.

Read full topic
item.source: Another great day for the stock market

item.title: Another great day for the stock market
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“m.dog311, post:7, topic:408979”]http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-14448881
“Yea, our economy sucks, but we should still have AAA status! You don’t know what you’re talking about!”[/quote]
It is like giving everyone top grades, the point of grades is to separate people. If you compare the most secure countries (Norway and other with no real debt) with US you would see a big difference on risk.

Frell:

capitalism doesnt fail it just rips people off

Correct, capitalism only favor the rich and companies. And if you look at the two right wing parties in US you would see that none of them really care about the people.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

BBC News

US 'unlikely to regain AAA soon'

The US is unlikely to regain its AAA rating any time soon, ratings agency S&P says, as it downgrades mortgage firms Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac.


“Yea, our economy sucks, but we should still have AAA status! You don’t know what you’re talking about!”
